page.para: One day, Kalpana’s mother gave her a new mat. It had lots of beautiful colours.
Kalpana loved her mat. She slept like a log on her mat. She always had sweet dreams.
Her mother said, “Take your mat with you when you go up to the hills. It will protect you.”
Up in the hills, Kalpana felt very safe on her mat. No snakes or scorpions or insects came near her.
But one day, Kalpana forgot to take her mat.
She got lost in the hills. She was afraid.
Night was coming. Kalpana longed for her mat. Eventually, she fell asleep under a tree.
When Kalpana woke, it was morning. A little bird was singing to her. Its feathers were the colours of her mat.
The little bird flew off, and Kalpana followed.
She followed the little bird with the colours of her mat.
The path went in two directions. Which way should Kalpana go?
After a while, the little bird stopped on a branch, and whistled. And there, below the branch, Kalpana saw her mother’s footprints!
Now Kalpana felt safe. She could follow the footprints. The little bird whistled goodbye. Then off it flew.
When Kalpana arrived home, the people in the village were very happy. And her mother was the happiest of all.
Kalpana’s mother gave her some delicious food. Kalpana sat on her mat and ate it. “Thank you, little bird,” she thought.
